title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 20 ยง 8189.10 - Coordinate locator number
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 20 ยง 8189.10 - Coordinate locator number

State Regulations
(a) Each land parcel shall have a coordinate locator number assigned to its visual
center. The coordinate locator number shall be derived from the appropriate
zone of the New York coordinate system. The easting reading must precede the
northing reading. The grid coordinate value describing the visual center of
each land parcel shall be accurate to a degree to ensure that the true position
of such coordinate falls within the boundaries of the land parcel being
described. A new coordinate locator number, which shall not duplicate any
previous coordinate locator number used, shall be assigned to each new land
parcel. (b) New York State plane
coordinate grid tic marks for the four corners of each section map shall be
accurately located and appear thereon along with a clear indication of the
visual center of each land parcel delineated on the section map. Coordinate
locator numbers for each land parcel delineated on the section map shall be
generated in a mechanized environment and appear together with the section, block and lot number for each such land parcel on a tape or other mechanized
media to be incorporated into a data base maintained by the county. This
mechanized media or the assessment roll supplied pursuant to article 15-C shall
be submitted by the county to ORPTS showing the section, block and lot number
together with the corresponding coordinate locator number for each land parcel
delineated on each section map within the county. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 20
ยง
8189.10

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
